intro: Viscum echinocarpum, commonly known as the spiny carposphere, is a parasitic plant belonging to the family Loranthaceae. It attaches itself to host trees, primarily in the genus Ficus, using its haustoria to absorb nutrients. The plant produces small, woody fruits that are characteristic of its species. Its flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female structures. Viscum echinocarpum is native to parts of Africa and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
